Posts.Content: Jan 27, 2011 09:02PM - edited Jan 27, 2011 09:05PM by kayj I feel you're frustration and anger.  I too had a mammo 1year ago... actually had to go back for repeat films. Came back normal and recommeded repeat in a year.  A few days later I got the letter about dense breasts.  Went to GYN for annual in Sept. and nothing noted on exam.  Felt a lump in the right side in Nov., nothing on left and then on routine mammo in Nov, there it was in the left breast.(right breast just a superficial cyst)  How could we all have missed my 2 cm mass? (Stage 2 grade 3 with node involvelment)  I opted for a single MX on left but am concerned about how to monitor the right.  Right now just trying to stay strong and forge ahead with this latest challenge.
Posts.Title: How could I go for yearly mammos and end up with a 6.5cm tumour? Cat123 scuttlers

Posts.Content: Jan 8, 2011 10:03AM kayj wrote: Just joined.  Had my L mastectomy ,SNB,TE done 1/5.  + nodes so they did dissection too.  Physically feeling OK after surgery but too much time to think. Discouraged about the nodes, no evidence of disease prior to surgery. The waiting is the worst part of this whole journey. It has been very helpful to hear everyone's story and know that your're not the only one on this journey.
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Jan 18, 2011 03:25PM kayj wrote: Cindy, Sorry to hear about the nodes.  I too found out that I had at least one positive node with my MX. Came as a surprise as no evidence of it before surgery. Still waiting on final path report from surgery to see how many positive.Have my first visit with the oncologist in a couple of weeks.  I had hoped the surgery would be enough but know chemo is ahead.  I too am scared but will deal with the next step as it comes up. Take care.
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Jan 15, 2011 09:18AM kayj wrote: To all those who recently had surgery or are scheduled soon.... Be patient, you'll feel better soon.  I am now 10days out of left MX with TE Every day was better than the last.  Tried to get out as soon as I felt well enough.  Got the last drain out yesterday (such a relief) and a fill on the TE.   Just feeling a little tightness. Looking forward to getting back to work which PS says can happen next week.  Wishing you all the best.
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Jan 18, 2011 03:16PM kayj wrote: I had a left MX with TE on 1/5.  I was able to sleep in bed with 1 or 2 pillows, on my back or turned slightly to the side.  Once I got my drains out I was able to sleep on my sides but with hugging a small pillow initially.  Slowly things are geting back to normal.
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2011 12:47PM kayj wrote: Calamity Jane, I so understand you're slow motion sense of time.  I was diagnosed in early Dec.  It just seems like such a waiting game, waiting for tests and MD appointments, wating for results, waiting to feel better.  It really does feel like time is moving in slow motion.  That being said I had my surgery 6 days ago (Left MX and TE) and have really been fine physically - it really wasn't bad at all.  Going out and getting back to normal activity.  I am getting a little tired of the zip up hoddie sweatshirts but they have been very comfortable and help to hide the drains and would recommend them to anyone going through this.  I also have a zip front sport bra that has worked well. Still waiting on results and nervous about what the next step will be.
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC
